name: ABS
description: Returns the absolute value.

name: ADDRLONG
description: Returns the memory address of a variable on a 64-bit platform.

name: AIRY
description: Returns the value of a differential equation.

name: ALLCOMB
description: Generates all combinations of the values of n variables taken k at a time in a minimal change order.

name: ALLPERM
description: Generates all permutations of the values of several variables in a minimal change order.

name: ANORM420
description: Returns a normalized string from an input string encoded in EBCDIC420.

name: ANYALNUM
description: Searches a character string for an alphanumeric character, and returns the first position at which the character is found.

name: ANYALPHA
description: Searches a character string for an alphabetic character, and returns the first position at which the character is found.

name: ANYCNTRL
description: Searches a character string for a control character, and returns the first position at which that character is found.

name: ANYDIGIT
description: Searches a character string for a digit, and returns the first position at which the digit is found.

name: ANYFIRST
description: Searches a character string for a character that is valid as the first character in a SAS variable name under VALIDVARNAME=V7, and returns the first position at which that character is found.

name: ANYGRAPH
description: Searches a character string for a graphical character, and returns the first position at which that character is found.

name: ANYLOWER
description: Searches a character string for a lowercase letter, and returns the first position at which the letter is found.

name: ANYNAME
description: Searches a character string for a character that is valid in a SAS variable name under VALIDVARNAME=V7, and returns the first position at which that character is found.

name: ANYPRINT
description: Searches a character string for a printable character, and returns the first position at which that character is found.

name: ANYPUNCT
description: Searches a character string for a punctuation character, and returns the first position at which that character is found.

name: ANYSPACE
description: Searches a character string for a whitespace character (blank, horizontal or vertical tab, carriage return, line feed, and form feed), and returns the first position at which that character is found.

name: ANYUPPER
description: Searches a character string for an uppercase letter, and returns the first position at which the letter is found.

name: ANYXDIGIT
description: Searches a character string for a hexadecimal character that represents a digit, and returns the first position at which that character is found.

name: ARCOS
description: Returns the arccosine.

name: ARCOSH
description: Returns the inverse hyperbolic cosine.

name: ARSIN
description: Returns the arcsine.

name: ARSINH
description: Returns the inverse hyperbolic sine.

name: ARTANH
description: Returns the inverse hyperbolic tangent.

name: ATAN
description: Returns the arc tangent.

name: ATAN2
description: Returns the arc tangent of the x and y coordinates of a right triangle, in radians.

name: ATTRC
description: Returns the value of a character attribute for a SAS data set.

syntax.help: ATTRC (*data-set-id*,             CHARSET | COMPRESS | DATAREP | ENCODING | ENCRYPT | ENGINE | LABEL | LIB | MEM | MODE | MTYPE | SORTEDBY | SORTLVL | SORTSEQ | TYPE)

name: ATTRN
description: Returns the value of a numeric attribute for a SAS data set.

syntax.help: ATTRN (*data-set-id*,             ALTERPW | ANOBS | ANY | ARAND | ARWU | AUDIT | AUDIT_DATA | AUDIT_BEFORE | AUDIT_ERROR | CRDTE | ICONST | INDEX | ISINDEX | ISSUBSET | LRECL | LRID | MAXGEN | MAXRC | MODTE | NDEL | NEXTGEN | NLOBS | NLOBSF | NOBS | NVARS | PW | RADIX | READPW | REUSE | TAPE | WHSTMT | WRITEPW)

name: AVG
description: Returns the arithmetic mean or average of all values in a column.

name: BAND
description: Returns the bitwise logical AND of 32-bit integer values.

name: BASECHAR
description: Converts characters to base characters.

name: BETA
description: Returns the value of the beta function.

name: BETAINV
description: Returns a quantile from the beta distribution.

name: BHAMMING_32
description: Returns the bitwise Hamming distance between two 32-bit integer values.

name: BHAMMING_HEX
description: Returns the bitwise Hamming distance between two hexadecimal bit strings.

name: BLACKCLPRC
description: Calculates call prices for European options on futures, based on the Black model.

name: BLACKPTPRC
description: Calculates put prices for European options on futures, based on the Black model.

name: BLKSHCLPRC
description: Calculates call prices for European options on stocks, based on the Black-Scholes model.

name: BLKSHPTPRC
description: Calculates put prices for European options on stocks, based on the Black-Scholes model.

name: BLSHIFT
description: Returns the bitwise logical left shift of two 32-bit integer values.

name: BNOT
description: Returns the bitwise logical NOT of 32-bit integer values.

name: BOR
description: Returns the bitwise logical OR of 32-bit integer values.

name: BRSHIFT
description: Returns the bitwise logical right shift of 32-bit integer values.

name: BTRIM
description: Removes blanks or specified characters from the beginning, the end, or both the beginning and end of a character string.

name: BXOR
description: Returns the bitwise logical EXCLUSIVE OR of two 32-bit integer values.

name: BYTE
description: Returns one character in the ASCII collating sequence.

name: CAT
description: Does not remove leading or trailing blanks and returns a concatenated character string.

name: CATQ
description: Concatenates character and numeric values by using a delimiter to separate items and by adding quotation marks to strings that contain the delimiter.

name: CATS
description: Removes leading and trailing blanks, and returns a concatenated character string.

name: CATT
description: Removes trailing blanks, and returns a concatenated character string.

name: CATX
description: Removes leading and trailing blanks, inserts delimiters, and returns a concatenated character string.

name: CDF
description: Returns a value from a cumulative probability distribution.

name: CEIL
description: Returns the smallest integer that is greater than or equal to the argument, fuzzed to avoid unexpected floating-point results.

name: CEILZ
description: Returns the smallest integer that is greater than or equal to the argument, using zero fuzzing.

name: CEXIST
description: Verifies the existence of a SAS catalog or SAS catalog entry.

name: CHAR
description: Returns a single character from a specified position in a character string.

name: CHOOSEC
description: Returns a character value that represents the results of choosing from a list of arguments.

name: CHOOSEN
description: Returns a numeric value that represents the results of choosing from a list of arguments.

name: CINV
description: Returns a quantile from the chi-square distribution.

name: CLIBEXIST
description: Returns 0 when the specified caslib name is not found and 1 when the caslib is found.

name: CLOSE
description: Closes a SAS data set.

name: CMISS
description: Counts the number of missing arguments.

name: CNONCT
description: Returns the noncentrality parameter from a chi-square distribution.

name: COALESCE
description: Returns the first nonmissing value from a list of columns.

name: COALESCEC
description: Returns the first nonmissing value from a list of character arguments.

name: COLLATE
description: Returns a character string in the ASCII collating sequence.

name: COMB
description: Computes the number of combinations of n elements taken r at a time.

name: COMPARE
description: Returns the position of the leftmost character by which two strings differ, or returns 0 if there is no difference.

name: COMPBL
description: Removes multiple blanks from a character string.

name: COMPFUZZ
description: Performs a fuzzy comparison of two numeric values.

name: COMPFUZZ_MISS
description: Performs comparisons of missing numeric values and fuzzy comparisons of nonmissing numeric values.

name: COMPGED
description: Returns the generalized edit distance between two strings.

name: COMPLEV
description: Returns the Levenshtein edit distance between two strings.

name: COMPOUND
description: Returns compound interest parameters.

name: COMPRESS
description: Returns a character string with specified characters removed from the original string.

name: COMPSRV_OVAL
description: Returns the original, possibly unsafe, value of an input parameter or global macro variable that is passed into the Compute server.

name: COMPSRV_SESSION
description: Creates or deletes a session.

name: COMPSRV_UNQUOTE2
description: Unmasks matched pairs of quotation marks in an input parameter or global macro variable.

name: CONSTANT
description: Computes machine and mathematical constants.

name: CONVX
description: Returns the convexity for an enumerated cash flow.

name: CONVXP
description: Returns the convexity for a periodic cash flow stream such as a bond.

name: COS
description: Returns the cosine.

name: COSH
description: Returns the hyperbolic cosine.

name: COT
description: Returns the cotangent.

name: COUNT
description: Returns the number of rows retrieved by a SELECT statement for a specified table.

name: COUNTC
description: Counts the number of characters that appear or do not appear in a list of characters.

name: COUNTW
description: Counts the number of words in a character string.

name: CSC
description: Returns the cosecant.

name: CSS
description: Returns the corrected sum of squares.

name: CUMIPMT
description: Returns the cumulative interest paid on a loan between the start and end periods.

name: CUMPRINC
description: Returns the cumulative principal paid on a loan between the start and end periods.

name: CUROBS
description: Returns the observation number of the current observation.

name: CV
description: Returns the coefficient of variation (percent).

name: DACCDB
description: Returns the accumulated declining balance depreciation.

name: DACCDBSL
description: Returns the accumulated declining balance with conversion to a straight-line depreciation.

name: DACCSL
description: Returns the accumulated straight-line depreciation.

name: DACCSYD
description: Returns the accumulated sum-of-years-digits depreciation.

name: DACCTAB
description: Returns the accumulated depreciation from specified tables.

name: DAIRY
description: Returns the derivative of the AIRY function.

name: DATDIF
description: Returns the number of days between two dates after computing the difference between the dates according to specified day count conventions.

name: DATE
description: Returns the current date as a SAS date value.

name: DATEJUL
description: Converts a Julian date to a SAS date value.

name: DATEPART
description: Extracts the date from a SAS datetime value.

name: DATETIME
description: Returns the current date and time of day as a SAS datetime value.

name: DAY
description: Returns the day of the month from a SAS date value.

name: DCLOSE
description: Closes a directory that was opened by the DOPEN function.

name: DCREATE
description: Returns the complete pathname of a new, external directory.

name: DEPDB
description: Returns the declining balance depreciation.

name: DEPDBSL
description: Returns the declining balance with conversion to a straight-line depreciation.

name: DEPSL
description: Returns the straight-line depreciation.

name: DEPSYD
description: Returns the sum-of-years-digits depreciation.

name: DEPTAB
description: Returns the depreciation from specified tables.

name: DEQUOTE
description: Removes matching quotation marks from a character string that begins with a quotation mark, and deletes all characters to the right of the closing quotation mark.

name: DEVIANCE
description: Returns the deviance based on a probability distribution.

name: DHMS
description: Returns a SAS datetime value from date, hour, minute, and second values.

name: DIF
description: Returns differences between an argument and its nth lag.

name: DIGAMMA
description: Returns the value of the digamma function.

name: DIM
description: Returns the number of elements in an array.

name: DINFO
description: Returns information about a directory.

name: DIVIDE
description: Returns the result of a division that handles special missing values for ODS output.

name: DLGCDIR
description: Sets the working directory.

name: DNUM
description: Returns the number of members in a directory.

name: DOPEN
description: Opens a directory, and returns a directory identifier value.

name: DOPTNAME
description: Returns directory attribute information.

name: DOPTNUM
description: Returns the number of information items that are available for a directory.

name: DOSUBL
description: Enables the immediate execution of SAS code after a text string is passed.

name: DREAD
description: Returns the name of a directory member.

name: DROPNOTE
description: Deletes a note marker from a SAS data set or an external file.

name: DSNAME
description: Returns the SAS data set name that is associated with a data set identifier.

name: DUR
description: Returns the modified duration for an enumerated cash flow.

name: DURP
description: Returns the modified duration for a periodic cash flow stream, such as a bond.

name: EFFRATE
description: Returns the effective annual interest rate.

name: ENCODCOMPAT
description: Verifies the transcoding compatibility between two encodings.

name: ENCODISVALID
description: Verifies a valid encoding name.

name: ENVLEN
description: Returns the length of an environment variable.

name: ERF
description: Returns the value of the (normal) error function.

name: ERFC
description: Returns the value of the complementary (normal) error function.

name: EUCLID
description: Returns the Euclidean norm of the nonmissing arguments.

name: EXIST
description: Verifies the existence of a SAS library member within a currently assigned SAS data library.

name: EXP
description: Returns the value of the exponential function.

name: EXPM1
description: Returns 1 less than the exponential function of the argument.

name: FACT
description: Computes a factorial.

name: FAPPEND
description: Appends the current record to the end of an external file.

name: FCLOSE
description: Closes an external file, directory, or directory member.

name: FCOL
description: Returns the current column position in the File Data Buffer (FDB).

name: FCOPY
description: Copies records from one fileref to another fileref, and returns a value that indicates whether the records were successfully copied.

name: FDELETE
description: Deletes an external file or an empty directory.

name: FETCH
description: Reads the next non-deleted observation from a SAS data set into the Data Set Data Vector (DDV).

name: FETCHOBS
description: Reads a specified observation from a SAS data set into the Data Set Data Vector (DDV).

name: FEXIST
description: Verifies the existence of an external file that is associated with a fileref.

name: FGET
description: Copies data from the File Data Buffer (FDB) into a variable.

name: FILEEXIST
description: Verifies the existence of an external file by its physical name.

name: FILENAME
description: Assigns or deassigns a fileref to an external file, directory, or output device.

name: FILEREF
description: Verifies whether a fileref has been assigned for the current SAS session.

name: FINANCE
description: Computes financial calculations such as depreciation, maturation, accrued interest, net present value, periodic savings, and internal rates of return.

name: FIND
description: Searches for a specific substring of characters within a character string.

syntax.help:
FIND (string, substring<, modifier(s)><, start-position>)
FIND (string, substring<, start-position><, modifier(s)>)

name: FINDC
description: Searches a string for any character in a list of characters.

syntax.help:
FINDC (string<, character-list>) 
FINDC (string, character-list<, modifier(s)>)
FINDC (string, character-list, modifier(s)<, start-position>)
FINDC (string, character-list, <start-position>, <modifier(s)>)

name: FINDW
description: Returns the character position of a word in a string, or returns the number of the word in a string.

syntax.help:
FINDW (string, word<, character(s)>)
FINDW (string, word, character(s), modifier(s)<, start-position>)
FINDW (string, word, character(s), start-position<, modifier(s)>)
FINDW (string, word, start-position<, character(s) <, modifier(s)>>)

name: FINFO
description: Returns the value of a file information item.

name: FINV
description: Returns a quantile from the F distribution.

name: FIPNAME
description: Converts two-digit FIPS codes to uppercase state names.

name: FIPNAMEL
description: Converts two-digit FIPS codes to mixed case state names.

name: FIPSTATE
description: Converts two-digit FIPS codes to two-character state postal codes.

name: FIRST
description: Returns the first character in a character string.

name: FLOOR
description: Returns the largest integer that is less than or equal to the argument, fuzzed to avoid unexpected floating-point results.

name: FLOORZ
description: Returns the largest integer that is less than or equal to the argument, using zero fuzzing.

name: FMTINFO
description: Retrieves information about a format or informat.

name: FNONCT
description: Returns the value of the noncentrality parameter of an F distribution.

name: FNOTE
description: Identifies the last record that was read, and returns a value that the FPOINT function can use.

name: FOPEN
description: Opens an external file and returns a file identifier value.

name: FOPTNAME
description: Returns the name of an item of information about an external file.

name: FOPTNUM
description: Returns the number of information items, such as filename or record length, that are available for an external file.

name: FPOINT
description: Positions the read pointer on the next record to be read.

name: FPOS
description: Sets the position of the column pointer in the File Data Buffer (FDB).

name: FPUT
description: Moves data to the File Data Buffer (FDB) of an external file, starting at the FDB's current column position.

name: FREAD
description: Reads a record from an external file into the File Data Buffer (FDB).

name: FREWIND
description: Positions the file pointer to the start of the file.

name: FRLEN
description: Returns the size of the last record that was read, or, if the file is opened for output, returns the current record size.

name: FSEP
description: Sets the token delimiters for the FGET function.

name: FUZZ
description: Returns the nearest integer if the argument is within 1E−12 of that integer.

name: FWRITE
description: Writes a record to an external file.

name: GAMINV
description: Returns a quantile from the gamma distribution.

name: GAMMA
description: Returns the value of the gamma function.

name: GARKHCLPRC
description: Calculates call prices for European options on stocks, based on the Garman-Kohlhagen model.

name: GARKHPTPRC
description: Calculates put prices for European options on stocks, based on the Garman-Kohlhagen model.

name: GCD
description: Returns the greatest common divisor for one or more integers.

name: GEODIST
description: Returns the geodetic distance between two latitude and longitude coordinates.

name: GEOMEAN
description: Returns the geometric mean.

name: GEOMEANZ
description: Returns the geometric mean, using zero fuzzing.

name: GETCASURL
description: Returns the value for a URL for connecting to the CAS Server Monitor.

name: GETLCASLIB
description: Returns the caslib that was bound to a CAS LIBNAME engine libref using the CASLIB= option when it was assigned.

name: GETLOCENV
description: Returns the current locale/language environment.

name: GETLSESSREF
description: Returns the session reference that is associated with a CAS LIBNAME engine libref.

name: GETLTAG
description: Returns the tag that was associated with a CAS LIBNAME engine libref in the TAG= option when it is assigned.

name: GETOPTION
description: Returns the value of a SAS system or graphics option.

name: GETPXLANGUAGE
description: Returns the current two-letter language code.

name: GETPXLOCALE
description: Returns the POSIX locale value for a SAS locale.

name: GETPXREGION
description: Returns the current two-letter region code.

name: GETSESSOPT
description: Returns the value for a SAS Cloud Analytic Services session option.

name: GETVARC
description: Returns the value of a SAS data set character variable.

name: GETVARN
description: Returns the value of a SAS data set numeric variable.

name: GETVARN_I64
description: Returns the value of a SAS data set integer variable.

name: GITFN_CLONE
description: Clones a Git repository into a directory on the SAS server.

syntax.help:
Form 1: 
GITFN_CLONE  (uri, directory)
Form 2: 
GITFN_CLONE  (uri, directory, <user, password, ssh-public-key, ssh-private-key>)

name: GITFN_COMMIT
description: Commits staged files to the local repository.

name: GITFN_COMMITFREE
description: Clears the commit record object that was created by GITFN_COMMIT_LOG for the specified repository.

name: GITFN_COMMIT_GET
description: Returns the specified attribute of the nth commit object that is associated with the local repository.

name: GITFN_COMMIT_LOG
description: Returns the number of commit objects that are associated with the local repository.

name: GITFN_CO_BRANCH
description: Check out a branch in a Git repository.

name: GITFN_DEL_BRANCH
description: Deletes a Git branch in the repository.

name: GITFN_DEL_REPO
description: Deletes a local Git repository and its contents.

name: GITFN_DIFF
description: Returns the number of diffs between two commits in the local repository and creates a diff record object for the local repository.

name: GITFN_DIFF_FREE
description: Clears the diff record object associated with a local repository.

name: GITFN_DIFF_GET
description: Returns the specified attribute of the nth diff object in the local repository.

name: GITFN_DIFF_IDX_F
description: Returns the changes for a file in the index.

name: GITFN_IDX_ADD
description: Stages 1 to n number of files to commit to the local repository.

name: GITFN_IDX_REMOVE
description: Unstages 1 to n number of files to commit to the local repository.

name: GITFN_MRG_BRANCH
description: Merges a Git branch into the currently checked-out branch.

name: GITFN_NEW_BRANCH
description: Creates a Git branch.

name: GITFN_PULL
description: Pulls changes from the remote repository into the local repository.

syntax.help:
Form 1: 
GITFN_PULL ( directory)
Form 2: 
GITFN_PULL ( directory, user, password)
Form 3: 
GITFN_PULL ( directory, ssh-user, ssh-password,ssh-public-key, ssh-private-key)

name: GITFN_PUSH
description: Pushes the committed files in the local repository to the remote repository.

syntax.help:
Form 1: 
GITFN_PUSH ( directory)
Form 2: 
GITFN_PUSH ( directory, user, password)
Form 3: 
GITFN_PUSH ( directory, ssh-user, ssh-password, ssh-public-key, ssh-private-key)

name: GITFN_RESET
description: Resets the local repository to a specified commit.

name: GITFN_RESET_FILE
description: Resets a file in the index to the local repository version.

name: GITFN_STATUS
description: Returns the status objects for files in the local repository and creates a status record.

name: GITFN_STATUSFREE
description: Clears the status record object that was created by GITFN_STATUS for the specified repository.

name: GITFN_STATUS_GET
description: Returns the specified attribute of the nth status object returned from GITFN_STATUS() in the local repository.

name: GITFN_VERSION
description: Specifies whether libgit2 is available and if available, specifies the version that is being used.

name: GIT_BRANCH_CHKOUT
description: Check out a branch in a Git repository.

name: GIT_BRANCH_DELETE
description: Deletes a Git branch in the repository.

name: GIT_BRANCH_MERGE
description: Merges a Git branch into the currently checked-out branch.

name: GIT_BRANCH_NEW
description: Creates a Git branch.

name: GIT_CLONE
description: Clones a Git repository into a directory on the SAS server.

syntax.help:
Form 1: 
GIT_CLONE  ('uri', 'directory '<,                         'user', 'password |                             personal-access-token'><, '',                         '',                         'SSL-CA-certificate-path', 0, '', 'customHeader'>)
Form 2: 
GIT_CLONE  ('uri', 'directory', 'user',                     'password', 'ssh-public-key-path', 'ssh-private-key-path'<, '', '', '', 0, '', 'custom-header'>)
Form 3: 
GIT_CLONE ('uri',                 'directory',                 '',                 '',                 '',                 '',                 'SSL-CA-certificate-path',                 kerberos<, 'custom-header'>)
Form 4: 
GIT_CLONE ('uri',                 'directory',                 '',                 '',                 '',                 '',                 '',                 2,                 auth-domain-ID<, custom-header>)

name: GIT_COMMIT
description: Commits staged files to the local repository.

name: GIT_COMMIT_COUNT
description: Returns the count of commits between two specified commits.

name: GIT_COMMIT_FREE
description: Clears the commit record object that was created by GIT_COMMIT_LOG for the specified repository.

name: GIT_COMMIT_GET
description: Returns the specified attribute of the nth commit object that is associated with the local repository.

name: GIT_COMMIT_LOG
description: Returns the number of commit objects that are associated with the local repository.

name: GIT_DELETE_REPO
description: deletes a local Git repository and all content within the repository.

name: GIT_DIFF
description: Returns the number of diffs between two commits in the local repository and creates a diff record object for the local repository.

name: GIT_DIFF_FILE_IDX
description: Returns the diff for a file in the index.

name: GIT_DIFF_FREE
description: Clears the diff record object associated with a local repository.

name: GIT_DIFF_GET
description: Returns the specified attribute of the nth diff object in the local repository.

name: GIT_DIFF_TO_FILE
description: Writes the diff content to a file reference.

name: GIT_FETCH
description: Fetches updates from the remote repository.

name: GIT_INDEX_ADD
description: Stages 1 to n number of files to commit to the local repository.

name: GIT_INDEX_REMOVE
description: Unstages 1 to n number of files to commit to the local repository.

name: GIT_INIT_REPO
description: Initializes a new local Git repository.

name: GIT_PULL
description: Pulls changes from the remote repository into the local repository.

syntax.help:
Form 1: 
GIT_PULL ( 'directory')
Form 2: 
GIT_PULL ( 'directory', 'user',                               'password'<, '', '', 'SSL-certificate-path', 0, '', 'custom-header'>)
Form 3: 
GIT_PULL ( 'directory', 'ssh-user',                               'ssh-password', 'ssh-public-key', 'ssh-private-key')
Form 4: 
GIT_PULL ('directory',                         '',                         '',                         '',                         '',                         'SSL-certificate-path',                         kerberos<, 'custom-header'>)
Form 5: 
GIT_PULL ('directory',                         '',                         '',                         '',                         '',                         '',2,                         auth-domain-ID<, 'custom-header'>)

name: GIT_PUSH
description: Pushes the committed files in the local repository to the remote repository.

syntax.help:
Form 1: 
GIT_PUSH ( 'directory')
Form 2: 
GIT_PUSH ( 'directory', 'user', 'password' <, '', '', 'SSL-certificate-path'><, 0, '', 'customHeader'>)
Form 3: 
GIT_PUSH ( 'directory', 'ssh-user', 'ssh-password', 'ssh-public-key',           'ssh-private-key')
Form 4: 
GIT_PUSH ('directory',         '',         '',         '',         '',         'SSL-certificate-path',         kerberos<, '', 'customHeader'>
Form 5: 
GIT_PUSH ('directory',         '',         '',         '',         '',         '',         2,         'auth-domain-ID'<, 'customHeader'>)

name: GIT_REBASE
description: Rebases your current branch to a specified commit ID.

name: GIT_REBASE_OP
description: Used to execute rebase operations when a conflict occurs.

name: GIT_REF_FREE
description: Clears the reference objects that are associated with the local repository.

name: GIT_REF_GET
description: Returns the specified attribute of a reference object in the local repository.

name: GIT_REF_LIST
description: Returns the list of reference objects that are associated with the local repository.

name: GIT_RESET
description: Resets the local repository to a specified commit.

name: GIT_RESET_FILE
description: Resets a file in the index to the local repository version.

name: GIT_SET_URL
description: Sets the remote repository URL for a local repository.

name: GIT_STASH
description: Stashes file changes that have not been committed.

name: GIT_STASH_APPLY
description: Applies file changes that are stored in a stash to the local repository.

name: GIT_STASH_DROP
description: Drops the contents of the stash stack at the specified index.

name: GIT_STASH_POP
description: Applies the changes that are stored in the stash, and then drops the contents of the stash.

name: GIT_STATUS
description: Returns the status objects for files in the local repository and creates a status record.

name: GIT_STATUS_FREE
description: Clears the status record object that was created by GIT_STATUS for the specified repository.

name: GIT_STATUS_GET
description: Returns the specified attribute of the nth status object returned from GITFN_STATUS() in the local repository.

name: GIT_VERSION
description: Specifies whether libgit2 is available and if available, specifies the version that is being used.

name: GRAYCODE
description: Generates all subsets of n items in a minimal change order.

syntax.help:
GRAYCODE (k, numeric-variable-1, ..., numeric-variable-n)
GRAYCODE (k, character-variable<, n <, in-out>>)

name: HARMEAN
description: Returns the harmonic mean.

name: HARMEANZ
description: Returns the harmonic mean, using zero fuzzing.

name: HASHING
description: Returns a message digest as a hexadecimal string for a message consisting of a character string, using different methods.

name: HASHING_FILE
description: Returns a message digest as a hexadecimal string for a message consisting of an entire file, using different hashing methods.

name: HASHING_HMAC
description: Returns a message digest as a hexadecimal string for a character HMAC key value and a message consisting of a character string, using various methods.

name: HASHING_HMAC_FILE
description: Returns a message digest as a hexadecimal string for an HMAC key value consisting of a character string and a message consisting of an entire file, using different methods.

name: HASHING_HMAC_INIT
description: Initializes a running HMAC hash and returns a numeric handle for use with HASHING_PART and HASHING_TERM.

name: HASHING_INIT
description: Initializes a running hash and returns a numeric handle for use with HASHING_PART and HASHING_TERM.

name: HASHING_PART
description: Provides part of a message for a running hash and returns a numeric value of 1 for a valid handle.

name: HASHING_TERM
description: Returns the final digest in hexadecimal representation for the running hash.

name: HASH_FAST_HEX
description: Returns a message digest as a 16-byte hexadecimal string for a key value and a message consisting of one or more character strings or numbers, using the fast-hash algorithm.

name: HASH_XX_HEX
description: Returns a message digest as a 16-byte hexadecimal string for a key value and a message consisting of one or more character strings or numbers.

name: HBOUND
description: Returns the upper bound of an array.

name: HMS
description: Returns a SAS time value from hour, minute, and second values.

name: HOLIDAY
description: Returns a SAS date value of a specified holiday for a specified year.

name: HOLIDAYCK
description: Returns the number of occurrences of the holiday value between date1 and date2.

name: HOLIDAYCOUNT
description: Returns the number of holidays defined for a SAS date value.

name: HOLIDAYNAME
description: Returns the name of the holiday that corresponds to the SAS date or a blank string if a holiday is not defined for the SAS date.

name: HOLIDAYNX
description: Returns the nth occurrence of the holiday relative to the date argument.

name: HOLIDAYNY
description: Returns the nth occurrence of the holiday for the year.

name: HOLIDAYTEST
description: Returns 1 if the holiday occurs on the SAS date value.

name: HOUR
description: Returns the hour from a SAS time or datetime value.

name: HTMLDECODE
description: Decodes a string that contains HTML numeric character references or HTML character entity references, and returns the decoded string.

name: HTMLENCODE
description: Encodes characters using HTML character entity references, and returns the encoded string.

name: IBESSEL
description: Returns the value of the modified Bessel function.

name: IFC
description: Returns a character value based on whether an expression is true, false, or missing.

name: IFN
description: Returns a numeric value based on whether an expression is true, false, or missing.

name: INDEX
description: Searches a character expression for a string of characters, and returns the position of the string's first character for the first occurrence of the string.

name: INDEXC
description: Searches a character expression for any of the specified characters, and returns the position of that character.

name: INDEXW
description: Searches a character expression for a string that is specified as a word, and returns the position of the first character in the word.

name: INPUT
description: Returns the value that is produced when SAS converts an expression by using the specified informat.

name: INPUTC
description: Enables you to specify a character informat at run time.

name: INPUTN
description: Enables you to specify a numeric informat at run time.

name: INT
description: Returns the integer value, fuzzed to avoid unexpected floating-point results.

name: INTCINDEX
description: Returns the cycle index when a date, time, or datetime interval and value are specified.

name: INTCK
description: Returns the number of interval boundaries of a given kind that lie between two dates, times, or datetime values.

syntax.help:
INTCK (interval<multiple><.shift-index>, start-date, end-date, <'method'>)
INTCK (custom-interval, start-date, end-date, <'method'>)

name: INTCYCLE
description: Returns the date, time, or datetime interval at the next higher seasonal cycle when a date, time, or datetime interval is specified.

name: INTFIT
description: Returns a time interval that is aligned between two dates.

name: INTFMT
description: Returns a recommended SAS format when a date, time, or datetime interval is specified.

name: INTGET
description: Returns a time interval based on three date or datetime values.

name: INTINDEX
description: Returns the seasonal index when a date, time, or datetime interval and value are specified.

name: INTNEST
description: Calculates the number of whole periods of the smaller interval that will fit into the period of the larger interval.

name: INTNX
description: Increments a date, time, or datetime value by a given time interval, and returns a date, time, or datetime value.

syntax.help:
INTNX (interval<multiple><.shift-index>, start-from, increment<, 'alignment'>)
INTNX (custom-interval, start-from, increment<, 'alignment'>)

name: INTRR
description: Returns the internal rate of return as a fraction.

name: INTSEAS
description: Returns the length of the seasonal cycle when a date, time, or datetime interval is specified.

name: INTSHIFT
description: Returns the shift interval that corresponds to the base interval.

name: INTTEST
description: Returns 1 if a time interval is valid, and returns 0 if a time interval is invalid.

name: INTZ
description: Returns the integer portion of the argument, using zero fuzzing.

name: INVCDF
description: Computes the quantile from any distribution for which you have defined a cumulative distribution function (CDF).

name: IORCMSG
description: Returns a formatted error message for _IORC_.

name: IPMT
description: Returns the interest payment for a given period for a constant payment loan or the periodic savings for a future balance.

name: IQR
description: Returns the interquartile range.

name: IRR
description: Returns the internal rate of return as a percentage.

name: ISNULL
description: Determines whether a pointer element of a structure is null.

name: JBESSEL
description: Returns the value of the Bessel function.

name: JSONPP
description: Creates a readable copy of JSON input.

name: JULDATE
description: Returns the Julian date from a SAS date value.

name: JULDATE7
description: Returns a seven-digit Julian date from a SAS date value.

name: KCHARLIST
description: Returns the character list according to the modifier.

name: KCOMPARE
description: Returns the result of a comparison of character expressions.

name: KCOMPRESS
description: Removes specified characters from a character expression.

name: KCOUNT
description: Returns the number of double-byte characters in an expression.

name: KCOUNTC
description: counts individual characters in a character string.

name: KCOUNTW
description: Counts the number of words in a character string.

name: KCOUNTX
description: Counts the number of times that a specified substring appears within a character string.

name: KCVT
description: Converts data from one type of encoding data to another type of encoding data.

name: KFIND
description: Searches for a specific substring of characters within a character string.

name: KFINDC
description: Searches a string for any character in a list of characters.

name: KFINDW
description: Returns the character position of a word in a string or the number of the word in a string.

name: KINDEX
description: Searches a character expression for a string of characters.

name: KINDEXB
description: Searches a character expression for specified characters and returns byte-based values.

name: KINDEXC
description: Searches a character expression for specified characters and returns character-based values.

name: KINDEXCB
description: Searches a character expression for specified characters and returns byte-based values.

name: KLEFT
description: Left-aligns a character expression by removing unnecessary leading DBCS blanks and SO/SI.

name: KLENGTH
description: Returns the length, in characters, of an argument.

name: KLOWCASE
description: Converts the uppercase alphabetic letters to lowercase letters.

name: KNEXTCHAR
description: Returns a character from a string at a specified byte offset.

name: KOFFSET
description: Returns the byte offset from the character position.

name: KPROPCASE
description: Converts Chinese, Japanese, Korean, Taiwanese (CJKT) characters.

name: KPROPCHAR
description: Converts Unicode to the corresponding characters enclosed in parenthesis.

name: KPROPDATA
description: Removes or converts unprintable characters.

name: KREVERSE
description: Reverses a character expression.

name: KRIGHT
description: Right-aligns a character expression by trimming trailing DBCS blanks and SO/SI.

name: KSCAN
description: Selects a specified word from a character expression.

name: KSCANX
description: Selects a specified word from a character expression using a modifier to process the function’s action.

name: KSTRCAT
description: Concatenates two or more character expressions.

name: KSTRIP
description: Removes leading and trailing blanks from a character string.

name: KSUBSTR
description: Extracts a substring from an argument.

name: KSUBSTRB
description: Extracts a substring from an argument according to the byte position of the substring in the argument.

name: KSUBSTRN
description: Returns a substring, allowing a result with a length of zero.

name: KTRANSLATE
description: Replaces specified characters in a character expression.

name: KTRIM
description: Removes trailing DBCS blanks and SO/SI from character expressions.

name: KTRUNCATE
description: Truncates a string to a specified length in byte unit without breaking multibyte characters.

name: KUPCASE
description: Converts the lowercase alphabetic letters to uppercase letters.

name: KUPDATE
description: Replaces character value contents.

name: KUPDATEB
description: Replaces the contents of the character value according to the byte position of the character value in the argument.

syntax.help:
KUPDATEB (argument, position, n<,characters-to-replace> )
KUPDATEB (argument, position<, n> , characters-to-replace)

name: KUPDATES
description: Replaces character value contents.

name: KURTOSIS
description: Returns the kurtosis.

name: KVERIFY
description: Returns the position of the first character (character-based value) that is unique to an expression.

name: KVERIFYB
description: Returns the position of the first character (byte-based value) that is unique to an expression.

name: LAG
description: Returns values from a queue.

name: LARGEST
description: Returns the kth largest nonmissing value.

name: LBOUND
description: Returns the lower bound of an array.

name: LCM
description: Returns the least common multiple.

name: LCOMB
description: Computes the logarithm of the COMB function, which is the logarithm of the number of combinations of n objects taken r at a time.

name: LEFT
description: Left-aligns a character string.

name: LENGTH
description: Returns the length of bytes of a non-blank character string, excluding trailing blanks, and returns 1 for a blank character string.

name: LENGTHC
description: Returns the length of a character string, including trailing blanks.

name: LENGTHM
description: Returns the amount of memory, in bytes, that is allocated for a character string.

name: LENGTHN
description: Returns the length of bytes in a character string, excluding trailing blanks.

name: LEXCOMB
description: Generates all distinct combinations of the nonmissing values of n variables taken k at a time in lexicographic order.

name: LEXCOMBI
description: Generates all combinations of the indices of n objects taken k at a time in lexicographic order.

name: LEXPERK
description: Generates all distinct permutations of the nonmissing values of n variables taken k at a time in lexicographic order.

name: LEXPERM
description: Generates all distinct permutations of the nonmissing values of several variables in lexicographic order.

name: LFACT
description: Computes the logarithm of the FACT (factorial) function.

name: LGAMMA
description: Returns the natural logarithm of the Gamma function.

name: LIBNAME
description: Assigns or clears a libref for a SAS library.

name: LIBREF
description: Verifies that a libref has been assigned.

name: LIMMOMENT
description: Computes the limited moment of any distribution for which you have defined a cumulative distribution function (CDF).

syntax.help:
imom=LIMMOMENT ('CDF-function-name', options-array, order, limit, 

	parameter-1 <, parameter-2, ...>);

name: LOG
description: Returns the natural (base e) logarithm.

name: LOG10
description: Returns the logarithm to the base 10.

name: LOG1PX
description: Returns the log of 1 plus the argument.

name: LOG2
description: Returns the logarithm to the base 2.

name: LOGBETA
description: Returns the logarithm of the beta function.

name: LOGCDF
description: Returns the logarithm of a left cumulative distribution function.

name: LOGISTIC
description: Returns the logistic transformation of the argument.

name: LOGPDF
description: Returns the logarithm of a probability density (mass) function.

name: LOGSDF
description: Returns the logarithm of a survival function.

name: LOWCASE
description: Converts all uppercase single-width English alphabet letters in an argument to lowercase.

name: LOWER
description: Converts the case of a character string to lowercase.

name: LPERM
description: Computes the logarithm of the PERM function, which is the logarithm of the number of permutations of n objects, with the option of including r number of elements.

name: LPNORM
description: Returns the Lp norm of the second argument and subsequent nonmissing arguments.

name: MAD
description: Returns the median absolute deviation from the median.

name: MARGRCLPRC
description: Calculates call prices for European options on stocks, based on the Margrabe model.

name: MARGRPTPRC
description: Calculates put prices for European options on stocks, based on the Margrabe model.

name: MAX
description: Returns the largest value.

name: MD5
description: Returns an MD5 message digest as a 16-byte binary string for a message consisting of a character string.

name: MDY
description: Returns a SAS date value from month, day, and year values.

name: MEAN
description: Returns the arithmetic mean (average).

name: MEDIAN
description: Returns median value.

name: MIN
description: Returns the smallest value.

name: MINUTE
description: Returns the minute from a SAS time or datetime value.

name: MISSING
description: Returns a numeric result that indicates whether the argument contains a missing value.

name: MOD
description: Returns the remainder from the division of the first argument by the second argument, fuzzed to avoid most unexpected floating-point results.

name: MODEXIST
description: Determines whether a software image exists in the version of SAS that you have installed.

name: MODULE
description: Calls a specific routine or module that resides in an external dynamic link library (DLL).

name: MODULEC
description: Calls an external routine and returns a character value.

name: MODULEN
description: Calls an external routine and returns a numeric value.

name: MODZ
description: Returns the remainder from the division of the first argument by the second argument, using zero fuzzing.

name: MONTH
description: Returns the month from a SAS date value.

name: MOPEN
description: Opens a file by directory ID and member name, and returns either the file identifier or a 0.

name: MORT
description: Returns amortization parameters.

name: MSPLINT
description: Returns the ordinate of a monotonicity-preserving interpolating spline.

name: MVALID
description: Checks the validity of a character string for use as a SAS member name.

name: N
description: Returns the number of nonmissing numeric values.

name: NDIMS
description: Returns the number of dimensions in an array.

name: NETPV
description: Returns the net present value as a percent.

name: NLDATE
description: Converts the SAS date value to the date value of the specified locale by using the date format descriptors.

name: NLDATM
description: Converts the SAS datetime value to the time value of the specified locale by using the datetime-format descriptors.

name: NLITERAL
description: Converts a character string that you specify to a SAS name literal.

name: NLTIME
description: Converts the SAS time or the datetime value to the time value of the specified locale by using the NLTIME descriptors.

name: NMISS
description: Returns the number of missing values in a table column.

name: NOMRATE
description: Returns the nominal annual interest rate.

name: NORMAL
description: Returns a random variate from a normal, or Gaussian, distribution.

name: NOTALNUM
description: Searches a character string for a non-alphanumeric character, and returns the first position at which the character is found.

name: NOTALPHA
description: Searches a character string for a nonalphabetic character, and returns the first position at which the character is found.

name: NOTCNTRL
description: Searches a character string for a character that is not a control character, and returns the first position at which that character is found.

name: NOTDIGIT
description: Searches a character string for any character that is not a digit, and returns the first position at which that character is found.

name: NOTE
description: Returns an observation ID for the current observation of a SAS data set.

name: NOTFIRST
description: Searches a character string for an invalid first character in a SAS variable name under VALIDVARNAME=V7, and returns the first position at which that character is found.

name: NOTGRAPH
description: Searches a character string for a non-graphical character, and returns the first position at which that character is found.

name: NOTLOWER
description: Searches a character string for a character that is not a lowercase letter, and returns the first position at which that character is found.

name: NOTNAME
description: Searches a character string for an invalid character in a SAS variable name under VALIDVARNAME=V7, and returns the first position at which that character is found.

name: NOTPRINT
description: Searches a character string for a nonprintable character, and returns the first position at which that character is found.

name: NOTPUNCT
description: Searches a character string for a character that is not a punctuation character, and returns the first position at which that character is found.

name: NOTSPACE
description: Searches a character string for a character that is not a whitespace character (blank, horizontal and vertical tab, carriage return, line feed, and form feed), and returns the first position at which that character is found.

name: NOTUPPER
description: Searches a character string for a character that is not an uppercase letter, and returns the first position at which that character is found.

name: NOTXDIGIT
description: Searches a character string for a character that is not a hexadecimal character, and returns the first position at which that character is found.

name: NPV
description: Returns the net present value with the rate expressed as a percentage.

name: NVALID
description: Checks the validity of a character string for use as a SAS variable name.

name: NWKDOM
description: Returns the date for the nth occurrence of a weekday for the specified month and year.

name: OPEN
description: Opens a SAS data set.

name: ORDINAL
description: Returns the kth smallest of the missing and nonmissing values.

name: PATHNAME
description: Returns the physical name of an external file or a SAS library, or returns a blank.

name: PCTL
description: Returns the percentile that corresponds to the percentage.

name: PDF
description: Returns a value from a probability density (mass) distribution.

name: PEEKCLONG
description: Stores the contents of a memory address in a character variable on a 64-bit platform.

name: PEEKLONG
description: Stores the contents of a memory address in a numeric variable on a 64-bit platform.

name: PERM
description: Computes the number of permutations of n items that are taken r at a time.

name: PMT
description: Returns the periodic payment for a constant payment loan or the periodic savings for a future balance.

name: POINT
description: Locates an observation that is identified by the NOTE function.

name: POISSON
description: Returns the probability from a Poisson distribution.

name: PPMT
description: Returns the principal payment for a given period for a constant payment loan or the periodic savings for a future balance.

name: PROBBETA
description: Returns the probability from a beta distribution.

name: PROBBNML
description: Returns the probability from a binomial distribution.

name: PROBBNRM
description: Returns a probability from a bivariate normal distribution.

name: PROBCHI
description: Returns the probability from a chi-square distribution.

name: PROBF
description: Returns the probability from an F distribution.

name: PROBGAM
description: Returns the probability from a gamma distribution.

name: PROBHYPR
description: Returns the probability from a hypergeometric distribution.

name: PROBIT
description: Returns a quantile from the standard normal distribution.

name: PROBMC
description: Returns a probability or a quantile from various distributions for multiple comparisons of means.

name: PROBMED
description: Computes cumulative probabilities for the sample median.

name: PROBNEGB
description: Returns the probability from a negative binomial distribution.

name: PROBNORM
description: Returns the probability from the standard normal distribution.

name: PROBT
description: Returns the probability from a t distribution.

name: PROPCASE
description: Converts all words in an argument to proper case.

name: PRT
description: Specifies the two-tailed p-value for Student's t statistic, T with n - 1 degrees of freedom.

name: PRXCHANGE
description: Performs a pattern-matching replacement.

name: PRXMATCH
description: Searches for a pattern match and returns the position at which the pattern is found.

name: PRXPAREN
description: Returns the last bracket match for which there is a match in a pattern.

name: PRXPARSE
description: Compiles a Perl regular expression (PRX) that can be used for pattern matching of a character value.

name: PRXPOSN
description: Returns a character string that contains the value for a capture buffer.

name: PTRLONGADD
description: Returns the pointer address as a character variable on a 64-bit platform.

name: PUT
description: Returns a value using a specified format.

name: PUTC
description: Enables you to specify a character format at run time.

name: PUTN
description: Enables you to specify a numeric format at run time.

name: PVP
description: Returns the present value for a periodic cash flow stream (such as a bond), with repayment of principal at maturity.

name: QTR
description: Returns the quarter of the year from a SAS date value.

name: QUANTILE
description: Returns the quantile from a distribution when you specify the left probability (CDF).

name: QUOTE
description: Adds double quotation marks to a character value.

name: RANBIN
description: Returns a random variate from a binomial distribution.

name: RANCAU
description: Returns a random variate from a Cauchy distribution.

name: RAND
description: Generates random numbers from a distribution that you specify.

name: RANDPERM
description: Randomly permutes the values of the arguments.

name: RANEXP
description: Returns a random variate from an exponential distribution.

name: RANGAM
description: Returns a random variate from a gamma distribution.

name: RANGE
description: Returns the range of the nonmissing values.

name: RANK
description: Returns the position of a character in the ASCII collating sequence.

name: RANNOR
description: Returns a random variate from a normal distribution.

name: RANPOI
description: Returns a random variate from a Poisson distribution.

name: RANTBL
description: Returns a random variate from a tabled probability distribution.

name: RANTRI
description: Returns a random variate from a triangular distribution.

name: RANUNI
description: Returns a random variate from a uniform distribution.

name: READ_ARRAY
description: Reads data from a SAS data set into a PROC FCMP array variable.

name: RENAME
description: Renames a member of a SAS library, an entry in a SAS catalog, an external file, or a directory.

name: REPEAT
description: Returns a character value that consists of the first argument repeated n+1 times.

name: RESOLVE
description: Returns the resolved value of the argument after the argument has been processed by the macro facility.

name: REVERSE
description: Reverses a character string.

name: REWIND
description: Positions the data set pointer at the beginning of a SAS data set.

name: RIGHT
description: Right aligns a character expression.

name: RMS
description: Returns the root mean square of the nonmissing arguments.

name: ROUND
description: Rounds the first argument to the nearest multiple of the second argument, or to the nearest integer when the second argument is omitted.

name: ROUNDE
description: Rounds the first argument to the nearest multiple of the second argument, and returns an even multiple when the first argument is halfway between the two nearest multiples.

name: ROUNDZ
description: Rounds the first argument to the nearest multiple of the second argument, using zero fuzzing.

name: RUN_MACRO
description: Executes a predefined SAS macro.

name: RUN_SASFILE
description: Executes SAS code in a fileref that you specify.

name: SASMSG
description: Specifies a message from a data set. The returned message is based on the current locale and a specified key.

name: SASMSGL
description: Specifies a message from a data set. The message is based on a specified locale value and a specified key value.

name: SAVING
description: Returns the future value of a periodic saving.

name: SAVINGS
description: Returns the balance of a periodic savings by using variable interest rates.

syntax.help:
SAVINGS (base-date, initial-deposit-date, deposit-amount, deposit-number, 
deposit-interval, compounding-interval, date-1, rate-2<, date-2, rate-2,  ..., date-n, rate-n>)

name: SCAN
description: Returns the nth word from a character string.

name: SDF
description: Returns a survival function.

name: SEC
description: Returns the secant.

name: SECOND
description: Returns the seconds and milliseconds from a SAS time or datetime value.

name: SESSBUSY
description: Determines whether a CAS session is busy processing actions.

name: SESSFOUND
description: Returns a 0 when a CAS session is not connected to a server and a 1 when the session is connected to a server.

name: SETLOCALE
description: Specifies the locale keys for the current SAS locale.

syntax.help:
Setting SAS LocaleSETLOCALE  (sas_locale)
Customize single locale elementsSETLOCALE  (key,value)
Customize single locale elements SETLOCALE  (category_name, sas_locale)

name: SHA256
description: Returns an SHA256 message digest as a 32-byte binary string for a message consisting of a character string.

name: SHA256HEX
description: Returns the SHA256 digest for a specified message, and the digest is provided in hexadecimal representation.

name: SHA256HMACHEX
description: Returns the result of the message digest of a specified string using the HMAC algorithm.

name: SIGN
description: Returns the sign of a value.

name: SIN
description: Returns the sine.

name: SINH
description: Returns the hyperbolic sine.

name: SKEWNESS
description: Returns the skewness of the nonmissing arguments.

name: SLEEP
description: Suspends the execution of a program that invokes this function for a period of time.

name: SMALLEST
description: Returns the kth smallest nonmissing value.

name: SOLVE
description: Computes implicit values of a function using the Gauss-Newton method.

syntax.help:
answer = SOLVE ('function-name', options-array, expected-value, 
argument-1<, argument-2, ...>);

name: SORT
description: Sorts a list of variables.

name: SORTKEY
description: Creates a linguistic sort key.

name: SOUNDEX
description: Encodes a string to facilitate searching.

name: SPEDIS
description: Determines the likelihood of two words matching, expressed as the asymmetric spelling distance between the two words.

name: SQRT
description: Returns the square root of a value.

name: SQUANTILE
description: Returns the quantile from a distribution when you specify the right probability (SDF).

name: STD
description: Returns the standard deviation of the nonmissing arguments.

name: STDERR
description: Returns the standard error of the mean of nonmissing arguments.

name: STFIPS
description: Converts state postal codes to FIPS state codes.

name: STNAME
description: Converts state postal codes to uppercase state names.

name: STNAMEL
description: Converts state postal codes to mixed case state names.

name: STRIP
description: Returns a character string with all leading and trailing blanks removed.

name: SUBPAD
description: Returns a substring that has a length that you specify, using blank padding if necessary.

name: SUBSTRING
description: Returns a part of a character expression.

name: SUBSTRN
description: Returns a substring, allowing a result with a length of zero.

name: SUM
description: Returns the sum of all the values.

name: SUMABS
description: Returns the sum of the absolute values of the nonmissing arguments.

name: SUMWGT
description: Specifies the sum of the WEIGHT variable values.

name: SYMEXIST
description: Returns an indication of the existence of a macro variable.

name: SYMGET
description: Returns the value of a macro variable during DATA step execution.

name: SYMGETN
description: In SAS Component Control Language (SCL) programs, returns the value of a global macro variable as a numeric value when the SCL program executes.

name: SYMGLOBL
description: Returns an indication of whether a macro variable is in global scope to the DATA step during DATA step execution.

name: SYMLOCAL
description: Returns an indication of whether a macro variable is in local scope to the DATA step during DATA step execution.

name: SYSEXIST
description: Returns a value that indicates whether an operating-environment variable exists in your environment.

name: SYSGET
description: Returns the value of the specified operating-environment variable.

name: SYSMSG
description: Returns error or warning message text from processing the last data set or external file function.

name: SYSPARM
description: Returns the system parameter string.

name: SYSPROCESSID
description: Returns the process ID of the current process.

name: SYSPROCESSNAME
description: Returns the process name that is associated with a given process ID, or returns the name of the current process.

name: SYSPROD
description: Determines whether a product is licensed.

name: SYSRC
description: Returns a system error number.

name: SYSTEM
description: Issues an operating environment command during a SAS session, and returns the system return code.

name: T
description: Specifies the student's t value for testing the hypothesis that the population mean is zero.

name: TAN
description: Returns the tangent.

name: TANH
description: Returns the hyperbolic tangent.

name: TIME
description: Returns the current time of day as a numeric SAS time value.

name: TIMEPART
description: Extracts a time value from a SAS datetime value.

name: TIMEVALUE
description: Returns the equivalent of a reference amount at a base date by using variable interest rates.

syntax.help:
TIMEVALUE (base-date, reference-date, reference-amount, compounding-interval,
date-1, rate-1<, date-2, rate-2,  ..., date-n, rate-n>)

name: TINV
description: Returns a quantile from the t distribution.

name: TNONCT
description: Returns the value of the noncentrality parameter from the Student's t distribution.

name: TODAY
description: Returns the current date as a numeric SAS date value.

name: TRANSLATE
description: Replaces specific characters in a character expression.

name: TRANSTRN
description: Replaces or removes all occurrences of a substring in a character string.

name: TRANTAB
description: Transcodes data by using the specified translation table.

name: TRANWRD
description: Replaces all occurrences of a substring in a character string.

name: TRIGAMMA
description: Returns the value of the trigamma function.

name: TRIM
description: Removes trailing blanks from a character string and returns one blank if the string is missing.

name: TRIMN
description: Removes trailing blanks from character expressions and returns a string with a length of zero if the expression is missing.

name: TRUNC
description: Truncates a numeric value to a specified number of bytes.

name: TSLVL
description: provides information about the specifics of the installation, including the release, hot fixes, and maintenance images.

name: TYPEOF
description: Returns a value that indicates whether the argument is character or numeric.

name: TZONEDSTNAME
description: Returns a daylight savings time name.

name: TZONEDSTOFF
description: Returns the time zone offset value for the specified daylight savings time.

name: TZONEID
description: Returns the current time zone ID.

name: TZONENAME
description: Returns the current standard or daylight savings time, time zone name.

name: TZONEOFF
description: Returns the user time zone offset.

name: TZONES2U
description: Converts a SAS date time value to a UTC date time value.

name: TZONESTTNAME
description: Returns a standard time zone name.

name: TZONESTTOFF
description: Returns the time zone offset value for the specified standard time.

name: TZONEU2S
description: Converts a UTC date time value to a SAS date time value.

name: UNICODE
description: Converts Unicode characters to the current SAS session encoding.

name: UNICODEC
description: Converts characters in the current SAS session encoding to Unicode characters.

name: UNICODELEN
description: Specifies the length of the character unit for the Unicode data.

name: UNICODEWIDTH
description: Specifies the length of a display unit for the Unicode data.

name: UNIFORM
description: Returns a random variate from a uniform distribution.

name: UPCASE
description: Converts all lowercase single-width English alphabet letters in an argument to uppercase.

name: UPPER
description: Converts the case of a character string to uppercase.

name: URLDECODE
description: Returns a string that was decoded using the URL escape syntax.

name: URLENCODE
description: Returns a string that was encoded using the URL escape syntax.

name: USS
description: Returns the uncorrected sum of squares of the nonmissing arguments.

name: UUIDGEN
description: Returns a Universally Unique Identifier (UUID) as a string of 36 hexidecimal characters and hyphens or a binary value of 16 bytes.

name: VAR
description: Returns the variance of the nonmissing arguments.

name: VARFMT
description: Returns the format that is assigned to a SAS data set variable.

name: VARINFMT
description: Returns the informat that is assigned to a SAS data set variable.

name: VARLABEL
description: Returns the label that is assigned to a SAS data set variable.

name: VARLEN
description: Returns the length of a SAS data set variable.

name: VARNAME
description: Returns the name of a SAS data set variable.

name: VARNUM
description: Returns the number of a variable's position in a SAS data set.

name: VARRAY
description: Returns a value that indicates whether the specified name is an array.

name: VARRAYX
description: Returns a value that indicates whether the value of the specified argument is an array.

name: VARTRANSCODE
description: Returns the transcode attribute of a SAS data set variable.

name: VARTYPE
description: Returns the data type of a SAS data set variable.

name: VERIFY
description: Returns the position of the first character in a string that is not in specified data strings.

name: VFORMAT
description: Returns the format that is associated with the specified variable.

name: VFORMATD
description: Returns the decimal value of the format that is associated with the specified variable.

name: VFORMATDX
description: Returns the decimal value of the format that is associated with the value of the specified argument.

name: VFORMATN
description: Returns the format name that is associated with the specified variable.

name: VFORMATNX
description: Returns the format name that is associated with the value of the specified argument.

name: VFORMATW
description: Returns the format width that is associated with the specified variable.

name: VFORMATWX
description: Returns the format width that is associated with the value of the specified argument.

name: VFORMATX
description: Returns the format that is associated with the value of the specified argument.

name: VINARRAY
description: Returns a value that indicates whether the specified variable is a member of an array.

name: VINARRAYX
description: Returns a value that indicates whether the value of the specified argument is a member of an array.

name: VINFORMAT
description: Returns the informat that is associated with the specified variable.

name: VINFORMATD
description: Returns the decimal value of the informat that is associated with the specified variable.

name: VINFORMATDX
description: Returns the decimal value of the informat that is associated with the value of the specified variable.

name: VINFORMATN
description: Returns the informat name that is associated with the specified variable.

name: VINFORMATNX
description: Returns the informat name that is associated with the value of the specified argument.

name: VINFORMATW
description: Returns the informat width that is associated with the specified variable.

name: VINFORMATWX
description: Returns the informat width that is associated with the value of the specified argument.

name: VINFORMATX
description: Returns the informat that is associated with the value of the specified argument.

name: VLABEL
description: Returns the label that is associated with the specified variable.

name: VLABELX
description: Returns the label that is associated with the value of the specified argument.

name: VLENGTH
description: Returns the compile-time (allocated) size of the specified variable.

name: VLENGTHX
description: Returns the compile-time (allocated) size for the variable with a name that is the same as the value of the argument.

name: VNAME
description: Returns the name of the specified variable.

name: VNAMEX
description: Validates the value of the specified argument as a variable name.

name: VTRANSCODE
description: Returns a value that indicates whether transcoding is enabled for the specified character variable.

name: VTRANSCODEX
description: Returns a value that indicates whether transcoding is enabled for the specified argument.

name: VTYPE
description: Returns the type (character or numeric) of the specified variable.

name: VTYPEX
description: Returns the type (character or numeric) for the value of the specified argument.

name: VVALUE
description: Returns the formatted value that is associated with the variable that you specify.

name: VVALUEX
description: Returns the formatted value that is associated with the argument that you specify.

name: WEEK
description: Returns the week-number value.

name: WEEKDAY
description: From a SAS date value, returns an integer that corresponds to the day of the week.

name: WHICHC
description: Searches for a character value that is equal to the first argument, and returns the index of the first matching value.

name: WHICHN
description: Searches for a numeric value that is equal to the first argument, and returns the index of the first matching value.

name: WRITE_ARRAY
description: Writes data from a PROC FCMP array variable to a data set that can then be used by SAS programs, macros, and procedures.

name: YEAR
description: Returns the year from a SAS date value.

name: YIELDP
description: Returns the yield-to-maturity for a periodic cash flow stream, such as a bond.

name: YRDIF
description: Returns the difference in years between two dates according to specified day count conventions; returns a person’s age.

name: YYQ
description: Returns a SAS date value from year and quarter year values.

name: ZIPCITY
description: Returns a city name and the two-character postal code that corresponds to a ZIP code.

name: ZIPCITYDISTANCE
description: Returns the geodetic distance between two ZIP code locations.

name: ZIPFIPS
description: Converts ZIP codes to two-digit FIPS codes.

name: ZIPNAME
description: Converts ZIP codes to uppercase state names.

name: ZIPNAMEL
description: Converts ZIP codes to mixed-case state names.

name: ZIPSTATE
description: Converts ZIP codes to two-character state postal codes.

name: DMSRVBATCHJOB
description: Runs a DataFlux data or process job on a DataFlux Data Management Server and returns a job identifier.

name: DMSRVCOPYLOG
description: Copies a job's log file from a DataFlux Data Management Server to a local host.

name: DMSRVDELETELOG
description: Deletes a job's log file from a DataFlux Data Management Server.

name: DMSRVJOBSTATUS
description: Returns the status of a job that was submitted to a DataFlux Data Management Server.

name: DMSRVKILLJOB
description: Terminates a job that is running on a DataFlux Data Management Server.

name: DMSRVPROFILEJOB
description: Generates a profile from a Data Management server repository.

name: DMSRVUSER
description: Registers a user on a DataFlux Data Management Server.

name: DMSRVVER
description: Returns the version of the DataFlux Data Management Server.

name: DQCASE
description: Returns a character value with standardized capitalization.

name: DQEXTINFOGET
description: Returns the names of the tokens that are supported by an extraction definition.

name: DQEXTRACT
description: Returns a delimited string of extraction token values from an input character value.

name: DQEXTTOKENGET
description: Returns an extraction token value from a delimited string of extraction token values.

name: DQEXTTOKENPUT
description: Inserts an extraction token value into a delimited string of extraction token values and returns the updated delimited string.

name: DQGENDER
description: Returns a gender determination from the name of an individual.

name: DQGENDERINFOGET
description: Returns the name of the parse definition that is associated with the specified gender definition.

name: DQGENDERPARSED
description: Returns the gender of an individual from a delimited string of parse token values.

name: DQIDENTIFY
description: Returns the highest-scoring identity for a character value.

name: DQIDENTIFYIDGET
description: Returns an identification analysis score for a given identity from a delimited string of identification analysis scores.

name: DQIDENTIFYINFOGET
description: Returns the names of the identities that are supported by a given identification analysis definition.

name: DQIDENTIFYMULTI
description: Returns all of the identification analysis scores of a character value.

name: DQLOCALEGUESS
description: Returns the ISO code of the highest-scoring locale for a character value.

name: DQLOCALEINFOGET
description: Returns a list of the locales that are loaded into memory.

name: DQLOCALEINFOLIST
description: Returns a count of definitions and displays the names of definitions for a type of definition in a locale.

name: DQLOCALESCORE
description: Returns a locale confidence score for an input character value.

name: DQMATCH
description: Returns a match code from a character value.

name: DQMATCHINFOGET
description: Returns the name of the parse definition that is associated with a match definition.

name: DQMATCHPARSED
description: Returns a match code from a delimited string of parse token values.

name: DQOPTSURFACE
description: Reveals or hides non-surfaced definitions.

name: DQPARSE
description: Returns a delimited string of parse token values.

name: DQPARSEINFOGET
description: Returns the names of the tokens that are supported by a parse definition.

name: DQPARSEINPUTLEN
description: Overrides the default expected length of parsed input and returns a string indicating its previous value.

name: DQPARSERESLIMIT
description: Overrides the default expected limit on resources consumed during parsing.

name: DQPARSESCORDEPTH
description: Overrides the default value that determines how deeply to search for the best parsing score.

name: DQPARSETOKENGET
description: Returns a parse token value from a delimited string of parse token values.

name: DQPARSETOKENPUT
description: Inserts a parse token value into a delimited string of parse token values and returns the updated delimited string.

name: DQPATTERN
description: Returns a pattern analysis from a character value.

name: DQSCHEMEAPPLY
description: Applies a scheme and returns a transformed character value.

name: DQSTANDARDIZE
description: Standardizes the casing, spacing, and format of certain words and abbreviations and returns an updated character value.

name: DQTOKEN
description: Returns the value of a token from an input character value.

name: DQVER
description: Returns the version of the SAS Data Quality engine.

name: DQVERQKB
description: Returns the version of the currently loaded QKB.
